title: Academic Research Grant Budget Compliance & Scenario Simulator
description: Upload multi-institutional draft budgets and funder/institutional rules to generate detailed compliance reports highlighting violations and risks. Simulate alternative budget allocation scenarios by submitting modifications to see compliance impact dynamically. Designed for academic research grant finance coordinators managing complex budgets.
inputLabel: Upload draft budget file (XLSX or CSV) and optionally paste funder rules or institutional policies text
outputLabel: Compliance report with flagged violations, risk summary, and scenario simulation feedback
systemPrompt: You are a compliance and scenario simulation assistant for academic research grant finance coordinators. Accept only XLSX or CSV budget files up to 10MB and optional funder/institutional rules text. Parse and analyze budgets against provided rules, returning detailed line-item compliance reports with flagged violations and risk assessments. Support user-submitted JSON scenario modifications to simulate alternative budgets and recalculate compliance. Reject unsupported file formats, oversized files, malformed JSON input, or unauthorized requests. Provide clear, actionable, and advisory compliance insights without legal binding statements. Output plain text or valid JSON if structured-output feature is enabled. Enforce strict data privacy and security. Refuse any requests outside the scope of budget compliance and scenario simulation. Use professional and clear language.

presets.label: Basic Compliance Report
presets.prompt: Analyze the uploaded budget file and supplied funder/institutional rules text. Generate a detailed compliance report highlighting all rule violations, flagged risks, and advisory suggestions for corrections.

presets.label: Scenario Simulation
presets.prompt: Given the uploaded budget and compliance rules, apply the following JSON scenario modifications to the budget line items: {{USER_SCENARIO_MODIFICATIONS}}. Return the updated budget summary and a compliance report reflecting the impact of these changes.

presets.label: Upload Guidance
presets.prompt: You are preparing to upload draft budget spreadsheets and related compliance documents. Provide clear instructions on accepted file formats, size limits, and required metadata to ensure successful upload and parsing.

presets.label: Compliance Summary for Export
presets.prompt: Summarize the compliance report suitable for export, including disclaimers, key flagged violations, risk summaries, and version metadata.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured output is enabled, compliance reports must include fields: violations (array with line item and rule references), riskSummary (string), and scenarioImpact (optional). Scenario simulation outputs include updatedBudget (reflecting modifications) and complianceReport.
clarifyPrompt: Please upload your draft budget file in XLSX or CSV format (max 10MB). Optionally, provide funder or institutional policy text to apply compliance rules. For scenario simulations, provide JSON describing budget line item modifications. Let me know if you need help preparing these inputs.
finalizePrompt: Here is your compliance report and/or scenario simulation result. Review flagged violations carefully and consider adjustments. Remember this tool provides advisory insights and does not replace final human or funder review. Would you like to simulate another scenario or export the results?

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Grant Budget Compliance & Scenario Simulator

niche.scenario: multi-institutional grant budget planning and compliance checking

idea.problem: Grant finance coordinators struggle to efficiently ensure that complex, multi-institutional grant budgets comply with varied funder rules and institutional policies while dynamically simulating alternative budget allocation scenarios to optimize funding and resource distribution.
inputs: Funder-specific budget compliance rules and constraints documents
outputs: Detailed, line-item-level compliance report highlighting rule violations and risks
Interactive, dynamic budget scenario simulations with constraint adjustments
Visual budget allocation dashboards per institution and expense category
Exportable optimized budget proposals and compliance summaries
whyItWins: Combines compliance checking and dynamic scenario simulation in one integrated workflow, reducing manual cross-checking and error risk
Supports complex multi-institutional collaborations with institution-specific policies and cost-sharing considerations
Provides visual analytics and exportable results facilitating transparent negotiation and decision-making
Evolves beyond static budget validation tools by enabling interactive what-if analyses to maximize funding efficiency and compliance

upgradePath.today: Lightweight tool to upload draft budgets and funder guidelines to generate basic compliance reports with flagging of violations and conflicts
upgradePath.in90Days: Add interactive scenario simulation features allowing finance coordinators to modify budget line items and instantly view compliance impact; include multi-user comment and negotiation threads
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full-featured multi-page web app integrating real-time collaboration, institutional policy libraries, cost-share tracking, automated reminders, and export-ready consolidated budgets and compliance documentation

riskNotes: Must ensure strict data security and privacy due to sensitive financial and personnel information
Avoid unauthorized funder or institutional policy interpretations by providing advisory, not legal or binding, compliance suggestions
Require clear disclaimers that final budget approval depends on human review and funder decisions
Ensure usability for non-expert finance staff by focusing on clarity and actionable insights

blueprint.summary: A web application for academic research grant finance coordinators to upload multi-institutional draft budgets and funder/institutional rules, generate compliance reports, and dynamically simulate budget scenarios to optimize allocations while ensuring adherence to complex policies.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic research grant finance coordinators managing multi-institutional budgets
successMetrics: Reduction in manual compliance checking time by >50%
User adoption rate among target finance coordinators
Number of scenario simulations run per budget
Decrease in compliance violations in final submitted budgets
Positive user feedback on usability and clarity of reports

edgeCases: Uploaded budgets with incomplete or inconsistent data fields
Conflicting compliance rules between funders and institutions
Large budget files causing parsing or performance issues
Simultaneous scenario edits by multiple users leading to version conflicts
Unauthorized access attempts to sensitive budget data
Export failures due to unsupported file formats or corrupted data
nonGoals: Providing legally binding compliance decisions or interpretations
Automated budget approval or submission to funders
Full accounting or financial transaction management
Real-time multi-user collaboration beyond comment threads in initial phases

dataFlow: User authenticates via /login page, receives auth token for subsequent requests.
User uploads budget files and related documents on /upload page, which sends POST /api/upload-budget with files and metadata.
API parses uploaded files, validates formats and size, normalizes multi-institutional budget data, stores in data-budget with versioning.
User navigates to /dashboard page, which fetches budget data via GET /api/budget/:id and displays interactive charts and tables.
User modifies budget line items inline; changes sent to POST /api/scenario-simulate/:budgetId with modifications JSON.
Scenario Simulation API applies modifications, recalculates compliance by calling POST /api/compliance-check/:budgetId with modifications, returns updated budget and compliance report.
Dashboard updates visual compliance warnings and scenario impact dynamically based on API responses.
User views detailed compliance reports on /compliance-report page, fetching compliance data via POST /api/compliance-check/:budgetId or scenario simulation results.
User exports reports or optimized budgets by requesting GET /api/export/:budgetId with desired format; API generates documents with disclaimers and metadata, returns file URL.
Background job PeriodicComplianceRecheck triggers on schedule or rule updates, re-runs compliance checks on stored budgets, updates compliance reports, and notifies users of new issues.
validationRules: File uploads must be XLSX or CSV format; reject unsupported formats with clear error messages.
Uploaded files must not exceed configured size limits (e.g., 10MB); reject with size error.
Budget data must include required fields: id, title, uploadDate, institutions, lineItems, version, ownerUserId.
Line items JSON must conform to expected schema (e.g., cost categories, amounts, institution references).
Compliance rules must have valid structuredConstraints JSON and version number.
API endpoints require authentication; reject unauthorized requests with 401 Unauthorized.
Scenario simulation modifications must be valid JSON with allowed fields; reject malformed or invalid changes.
Export format parameter must be either 'pdf' or 'excel'; reject unsupported formats with 400 Bad Request.
On upload, partial or malformed data should be handled gracefully with warnings; reject only if critical errors.
Versioning increments on each scenario simulation or upload to maintain history and rollback capability.
errorHandling: All API routes return consistent JSON error responses with 'success: false' and 'errors' array describing issues.
File upload errors (format, size, parsing) return detailed messages to UI for user correction.
Unauthorized access attempts return 401 Unauthorized with message 'Authentication required'.
Not found budgets or resources return 404 Not Found with descriptive message.
Conflicting compliance rules detected during compliance check are reported in compliance report with prioritization explanation.
Scenario simulation conflicts (e.g., version mismatch) return 409 Conflict with instructions to refresh data.
Export failures return 500 Internal Server Error with user-friendly message and log details for debugging.
Background job failures are logged and retried with exponential backoff; users notified if compliance data is stale.
UI displays error banners or inline messages based on API error responses to guide user actions.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication except /login; enforce JWT or session-based auth.
User authorization checks ensure users can only access budgets they own or are permitted to view.
Sensitive budget data and compliance reports are encrypted at rest in the database.
File uploads are scanned and sanitized to prevent injection or malware.
Rate limiting applied on upload and simulation APIs to prevent abuse or DoS.
Background job notifications respect user privacy and only notify relevant users.
Exported documents include disclaimers to avoid legal liability.
Ensure CORS policies restrict API access to trusted frontend origins.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communications to protect data in transit.
Log authentication failures and suspicious activities for audit and alerting.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated finance coordinator on the /upload page
acceptanceTests.when: They upload a valid XLSX budget file and related documents within size limits
acceptanceTests.then: The system parses and stores the budget, returns success with budgetId, and displays upload status with no errors

acceptanceTests.given: A user on the /dashboard page viewing a budget
acceptanceTests.when: They modify line item amounts inline and submit changes
acceptanceTests.then: The scenario simulation API returns updated budget and compliance report, and the UI updates charts and warnings accordingly

acceptanceTests.given: A user requests a compliance report for a budget with known rule violations
acceptanceTests.when: They access /compliance-report page and fetch the report
acceptanceTests.then: The report displays all flagged violations with risk summaries and allows export options

acceptanceTests.given: A user attempts to upload a file exceeding size limits or unsupported format
acceptanceTests.then: The system rejects the upload with clear error messages and does not store invalid data

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user tries to access /dashboard or API routes
acceptanceTests.when: They make requests without valid auth token
acceptanceTests.then: The system responds with 401 Unauthorized and prompts for login

acceptanceTests.given: Background job runs after compliance rule updates
acceptanceTests.when: It re-runs compliance checks on stored budgets
acceptanceTests.then: Users with affected budgets receive notifications about new compliance issues

acceptanceTests.given: A user requests export in PDF format for a budget
acceptanceTests.then: The system generates and returns a downloadable PDF file including disclaimers and metadata

acceptanceTests.given: Two users simultaneously edit the same budget scenario
acceptanceTests.then: The system detects version conflicts and returns 409 Conflict with instructions to refresh
